instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B rare symptoms.
threads.message:
Hi I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B with a number of problems.
1. Do not turn on only 1 time pressing the power button, touch let sustained 6 seconds to turn pro macbook.
2. You can not enter that state S3 is turned off, touch again let sustained 6 seconds to turn power button.
3. THE ASD brings me 9 errors. These can cause the above problems?
Annex photos of the reports of ASD. Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B rare symptoms.
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage. Was this liquid damage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B rare symptoms.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7034"]Check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage. Was this liquid damage?[/QUOTE]

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> = 0.07v  on <CAPACITOR>C4920</CAPACITOR>

I do not see traces of moisture or sulphate
NOTE: Only turn on with the battery connected. I went to measure care <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> is behind the board, trying to turn the power pad note that ignites only if, if the battery is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B rare symptoms.
threads.message: AVREF should be 3.3V! So <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> is bad or one of the 4 capacitors on the bus is leaky and pulling it down.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B rare symptoms.
threads.message:
No Title

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 7046"]AVREF should be 3.3V! So <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> is bad or one of the 4 capacitors on the bus is leaky and pulling it down.[/QUOTE]
Certeinly <CAPACITOR>C5025</CAPACITOR> had a short. Multimeter showed a resistence to GND 0.02Ohms. I extracted the <CAPACITOR>C5025</CAPACITOR> and the shorte disappeared, so the MacBook Pro turned on. I did the ADS and the error sensors desappeared, it's all OK. Then, the machine was turned on and working, but 20 minutes later the computer turned off, just by itself. Now i have green light on the magsafe AC,  but it doesn't turn on. The voltage is missing in <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> pin 3 and 8 =<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS_ROM</SIGNAL> .  When i try to turn it on, the fan has a little little movement but the machine doesn't turn on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B rare symptoms.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B rare symptoms.
threads.message: I think if it was liquid but long ago! I do not see traces of moisture, <CAPACITOR>C5025</CAPACITOR> I drew was something sulfated on pin 1, but have inspected well the board and see no sulfate or something stranger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B rare symptoms.
threads.message: Probably some corrosion under SMC or PCH. Or another capacitor that shorted. Look closer for corrosion.
